commit_message:
Add missing ComputeNeutronMetadataAgent service into tripleo_containers.yaml.j2.

When using DVR the Compute roles make use of the services
ComputeNeutronOvsAgent, ComputeNeutronL3Agent, ComputeNeutronMetadataAgent
and ComputeNeutronCorePlugin. However, the ComputeNeutronMetadataAgent was
missing from the tripleo_containers.yaml.j2 which causes issues at the time
of retrieving the images from the Undercloud registry.

Related-Bug: #1898256
Change-Id: I52204ec1bcb3a43e5d8e8503871a27b8bfb88e7b
(cherry picked from commit d2a5d9856d109ce39f598dc64aeb41e9e4f3304b)

commit_message:
Fix start order for {swift_proxy,glance_api}_tls_proxy

In stack updates adding TLS to Swift would not work because
swift_proxy_tls_proxy is started when the pre-existing
swift_proxy container is still up and listening on the TCP port
which should instead be used by swift_proxy_tls_proxy

This change ensures swift_proxy_tls_proxy and glance_api_tls_proxy
containers are started after the actual swift_proxy and glance_api
containers are started.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Change-Id: I980dfc54b799c6b1d648489a727a590dd26fa502
Closes-Bug: 1918642

commit_message:
Activate virtual environment

Enable virtualenv after installation. Without it, python packages from
system location will be used. So if bindep is not installed in system
packages the failure will be as

~/tripleo-validations/scripts/..//scripts/bindep-install: line 37: bindep: command not found

This patch activates virtualenv after creation on previous step in
accordance rather than before pytest.

Change-Id: I3725bf64bead30b02f10eb9a68d220c4e422b531
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/21/779021/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix logic to honor HorizonDebug

Debug always has one of true/false and is always set. We should check
whether HorizonDebug is set instead of whether Debug is set.

Also, this change fixes the current logic to make sure that
HorizonDebug: false is honored even when Debug: true is set.

Closes-Bug: #1908362
Change-Id: I514b5a3d4133d3561376ea06a803d019acaa0f0b

commit_message:
Optimise resource type listing

Minimise the amount of work needed to filter the list of resource types.

Change-Id: If2ccb662a3591336625a3ab0581efbcf2b0ca62e
Task: 37976
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/08/701408/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if type_name is not None: try: name_exp = re.compile(type_name) except Exception: return [] else: name_exp = None def matches(name, info): # Only return actual plugins or template resources, not aliases if not isinstance(info, (ClassResourceInfo, TemplateResourceInfo)): # If filtering by name, check for match if name_exp is not None and not name_exp.match(name): return False rsrc_cls = info.get_class_to_instantiate() # Never match hidden resource types if rsrc_cls.support_status.status == support.HIDDEN: return False # If filtering by version, check for match if (version is not None and rsrc_cls.support_status.version != version): return False # If filtering by support status, check for match if (support_status is not None and rsrc_cls.support_status.status != support_status): return False if cnxt is not None: # Check for resource policy try: enforcer.enforce(cnxt, name, is_registered_policy=True) except enforcer.exc: return False # Check for service availability try: avail, err = rsrc_cls.is_service_available(cnxt) except Exception: avail = False if not avail: return False return True def resource_description(name, info): return [resource_description(name, info) for name, info in six.iteritems(self._registry) if matches(name, info)]
deleted_lines: def is_resource(key): return isinstance(self._registry[key], (ClassResourceInfo, TemplateResourceInfo)) def status_matches(cls): return (support_status is None or cls.get_class().support_status.status == support_status) def is_available(cls): if cnxt is None: return True try: return cls.get_class().is_service_available(cnxt)[0] except Exception: return False def not_hidden_matches(cls): return cls.get_class().support_status.status != support.HIDDEN def is_allowed(enforcer, name): if cnxt is None: return True try: enforcer.enforce(cnxt, name, is_registered_policy=True) except enforcer.exc: return False else: return True def name_matches(name): try: return type_name is None or re.match(type_name, name) except: # noqa def version_matches(cls): return (version is None or cls.get_class().support_status.version == version) def resource_description(name, info, with_description): return [resource_description(name, cls, with_description) for name, cls in six.iteritems(self._registry) if (is_resource(name) and name_matches(name) and status_matches(cls) and is_available(cls) and is_allowed(enforcer, name) and not_hidden_matches(cls) and version_matches(cls))]

@utils.arg('--description', metavar='<DESCRIPTION>', required=False, help='Description of segment.') def do_segment_update(service, args): """Update a segment.""" try: segment_id = utils.get_uuid_by_name( service, args.id) attrs = { 'name': args.name, 'description': args.description, 'recovery_method': args.recovery_method, 'service_type': args.service_type, } attrs = service.hosts(segment_id) fields = [ 'uuid', 'name', 'type', 'control_attributes', 'reserved', 'on_maintenance', 'failover_segment_id'] utils.print_list(hosts, fields) except Exception as e: print(e) def do_host_show(service, args): """Show a host details.""" try: segment_id = utils.get_uuid_by_name( service, args.segment_id) host_id = utils.get_uuid_by_name( service, args.id, segment=segment_id) host = service.get_host(host_id, segment_id=segment_id) utils.print_dict(host.to_dict()) except Exception as e: print(e) @utils.arg('--name', metavar='<HOST_NAME>', required=True, help='Name of The supported options are: ' 'True, False.') @utils.arg('--name', metavar='<HOST_NAME>', required=False, help='Name of host.') @utils.arg('--type', metavar='<TYPE>', required=False, help='Type of host.') @utils.arg('--control-attributes', metavar='<CONTROL_ATTRIBUTES>', required=False, help='Control attributes of host.') def do_host_update(service, args): """Update a host.""" try: segment_id = utils.get_uuid_by_name( service, args.segment_id) host_id = utils.get_uuid_by_name( service, args.id, segment=segment_id) attrs = { 'name': args.name, 'type': args.type, 'control_attributes': args.control_attributes, 'reserved': args.reserved, 'on_maintenance': args.on_maintenance, } attrs = utils.remove_unspecified_items(attrs) host = service.update_host(host_id, segment_id=segment_id, **attrs) utils.print_dict(host.to_dict()) except Exception as e: print(e) @utils.arg('--segment-id', metavar='<SEGMENT_ID>', required=True, help='Name or ID of segment.') @utils.arg('--id', metavar='<HOST_ID>', required=True, help='Name or ID of the host to delete.') def do_host_delete(service, args): """Delete a host.""" try: segment_id = utils.get_uuid_by_name( service, args.segment_id) host_id = utils.get_uuid_by_name( service, args.id, segment=segment_id) host = service.delete_host(host_id, segment_id=segment_id, ignore_missing=False) utils.print_dict(host.to_dict()) except Exception as e: print(e)

commit_message:
Refactor nova db config

It is best to avoid placing db creds on the compute nodes to limit the
exposure if an attacker succeeds in gaining access to the hypervisor
host.

Related patches in puppet-nova remove the credentials from nova.conf
however the current scope of db credential hieradata is all nova tripleo
services - so it will but written to the hieradata keys on compute
nodes.

This patch refactors the nova hieradata structure, splitting the
nova-api/nova database hieradata out into individual templates and
selectively including only where necessary, ensuring we have no db
creds on a compute node (unless it is an all-in-one api+compute node).

Conflicts:
	deployment/nova/nova-manager-container-puppet.yaml
        deployment/nova/nova-compute-common-container-puppet.yaml

Depends-On: I07caa3185427b48e6e7d60965fa3e6157457018c
Change-Id: Ia4a29bdd2cd8e894bcc7c0078cf0f0ab0f97de0a
Closes-bug: #1871482
(cherry picked from commit 9d82364de8d6d1fba083993e085fb8cafcc08268)
(cherry picked from commit a2a6ddab59e60ba977ac85b9881530ae3b5bb0c7)

commit_message:
Stable jobs: run the tests on victoria, remove stein

Update the list of tested stable branches (excluding stein which is EM).
The nodesets for the stable branches are now pinned because
their testing environment are well defined and won't change.

Also, remove the -py3 suffix: those jobs are all -py3 based
(the suffix was mostly requires in the transitional time
between py2 and py3).

Change-Id: I48f8574960df51fc47f80fa17091fd13ec71aa99

commit_message:
Add replication_probe_interval for ovsdbs

Add posibilities to configure replication_probe_interval for ovsdb-server.
It configure probe interval for connection for ovsdb-server when it is
in backup mode and connects to the active ovsdb-server for replication

Change-Id: I80c2377ea0223f0003e8e0982f1bc3c1b32b6d06
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/52/727652/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

It configure probe interval for connection for ovsdb-server when it is # in backup mode and connects to the active ovsdb-server for replication # Defaults to 60000 # $ovn_dbs_docker_image = undef, $ovn_dbs_control_port = 3125, $bootstrap_node = hiera('ovn_dbs_short_bootstrap_node_name'), $step = Integer(hiera('step')), $pcs_tries = hiera('pcs_tries', 20), $ovn_dbs_vip = hiera('ovn_dbs_vip'), $nb_db_port = 6641, $sb_db_port = 6642, $meta_params = '', $op_params = '', $container_backend = 'docker', $tls_priorities = hiera('tripleo::pacemaker::tls_priorities', undef), $bundle_user = undef, $log_driver = undef, $log_file = '/var/log/containers/stdouts/ovn-dbs-bundle.log', $enable_internal_tls = hiera('enable_internal_tls', false), $ca_file = undef, $dbs_timeout = 60, $listen_on_master_ip_only = 'yes' $replication_probe_interval = 60000 ) { if $bootstrap_node and $::hostname == downcase($bootstrap_node) {listen_on_master_ip_only=${listen_on_master_ip_only} inactive_probe_interval_to_master=${replication_probe_interval}"

commit_message:
Stop including nova::metadata on computes

I5da1e67684f8317eec8c499c3534977e00a63098 include nova::metadata on computes
however this includes nova::db which we must not do on computes.
Push the fix up to puppet-nova and nova.

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary zuul layout overrides use templates instead

This removes unnecessary zuul layout overrides. The containers
multinode and standalone/scenarios are already included via the
wired-up templates. Keeps only the undercloud-minion which is not
in the tripleo-multinode-container-minimal-pipeline [1] but updates
the consumer job vars. Part of tripleo-ci optimisation at [2].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/src/commit/67a58a43788dfff284ec55eff6f4e65c0116160b/zuul.d/multinode-jobs.yaml#L71-L85
[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Change-Id: I7c4ba85cbc1525079a94cb76aa9576b24f1d0fbb

commit_message:
[Pure] Add missing FC host personality support

Previously this was only set for iSCSI hosts and FC hosts were missed.
Fix to allow feature to cover Fibre Channel attached hosts as well.

Change-Id: Ie097d8938aa9cac6b28efef37f805338be4b0336

commit_message:
Depend on corresponding server in WaitCondition

most of the templates used in scenario tests already do this
to exclude unpredictable (especially in virtualized cloud CI environments)
server boot from the wait condition timeout, however 3 templates
(used in 3 tests) are missing this at the moment.

This patch adds an explicit depends_on on the server that the
WaitCondition is waiting for in all scanario templates that use
WaitConditions.

Change-Id: I43d5b3862970db5217651b570525f696910bf320

logging level and so on.

commit_message:
Release final python-tackerclient for Wallaby

This proposed a release for python-tackerclient to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Wallaby going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Monday, March 11.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 1.5.0..4e6dc4c
4e6dc4c CLI for Individual VNF LCM Operation Occurrence
6b29bb7 Support CLI for Getting List of VNF LCM Operation Occurrences
1299e15 Support of Retry VNF command in openstackclient
cfe1411 Support CLI of Change External VNF Connectivity
5816753 Support of Fail VNF command in openstackclient
e7a0c96 Fix error message for nonexistent vnf package
68df829 Dropping explicit unicode literal
17f4bca Fix old links in installation guide
69d9668 Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I84ada4201cd05b2d65c8c28d5cb7208f7700e038

commit_message:
Add XueFeng Liu candidacy for Senlin PTL in Xena

Change-Id: Iecaf77c33aba9518ca56394db929a0801cd51b1c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/56/779656/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hi all, This is my candidacy to continue my work as the Senlin PTL for the Xena cycle. In past several cycles, we finished many features, testing and bug fixing works. For example: * Kubernetes: Added dependency relationship between the master cluster and the worker cluster created for Kubernetes. * Docker driver: Supported update name operation for docker profile. * Nova server: Added operation support to migrate a nova server node. * Health check improve: Added a new detection type that actively pools the node health using a URL specified in the health policy. * Split Senlin-Engine service into three services to make the engine more resilent. * OpenStack-wide Goals: Add Python3 victoria unit tests * Testing: API/Function/Integration test were moved to senlin-tempest-plugin. As a PTL in Xena cycle, I'd like to continue to focus on the tasks as follows: * Continue to improve and review commits * Actively monitor incoming bug reports and assigned to fix them. * Acknowledgment of OpenStack-wide Goals. Thanks for taking the time to read through this Roadmap and to consider my candidacy. Best Regards, XueFeng

commit_message:
Always reset CONF when starting the wsgi app

This ensures that options loaded during any prior run of the
application are dropped before being added again during init_application.

Change-Id: I968cbe6091856c3090840511e8006af518b99f3a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/24/733524/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(hberaud): Call reset to ensure the ConfigOpts object doesn't # already contain registered options if the app is reloaded. CONF.reset()

commit_message:
CI: Use cached cirros image for seed vm job

The nodepool images include CirrOS images.

Also update to newly released 0.5.2 image.

Change-Id: I95fc2c3873c8cd17edf928f613a06d2154196786
(cherry picked from commit 39b3fe70c6cddc22e4b75c70379bcb0a0a717c90)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/34/779934/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <<<<<<< HEAD (a6b68e Merge "CI: use overlay2 storage driver for overcloud deploy") ======= --- # NOTE(mgoddard): Don't reboot after disabling SELinux during CI testing, as # Ansible is run directly on the controller. disable_selinux_do_reboot: false {% if ansible_os_family == 'Debian' %} # On Ubuntu, use 5 seconds delay to allow for interfaces to come up after ifup # exits. interfaces_pause_time: 5 {% endif %} # Use the OpenStack infra's Dockerhub mirror. docker_registry_mirrors: - "http://{{ zuul_site_mirror_fqdn }}:8082/" kolla_source_url: "{{ ansible_env.PWD ~ '/' ~ zuul.projects['opendev.org/openstack/kolla'].src_dir }}" kolla_source_version: "{{ zuul.projects['opendev.org/openstack/kolla'].checkout }}" kolla_ansible_source_url: "{{ ansible_env.PWD ~ '/' ~ zuul.projects['opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible'].src_dir }}" kolla_ansible_source_version: "{{ zuul.projects['opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible'].checkout }}" kolla_openstack_logging_debug: True pip_upper_constraints_file: "/tmp/upper-constraints.txt" # The hosts used by Zuul may or may not have Virtualization Technology (VT) # enabled. Don't fail if it's disabled. libvirt_host_require_vt: false # Nested virtualisation is not working well in CI currently. Force the use of # QEMU. libvirt_vm_engine: "qemu" # Use the CI infra's PyPI mirror. pip_local_mirror: true pip_index_url: "http://{{ zuul_site_mirror_fqdn }}/pypi/simple" pip_trusted_hosts: - "{{ zuul_site_mirror_fqdn }}" # Try with only a single VCPU, word on the street is that QEMU doesn't play # nicely with more than one. seed_vm_vcpus: 1 # Reduce the memory footprint of the seed VM. seed_vm_memory_mb: "{{ 1 * 1024 }}" # Use cirros rather than CentOS for the VM. seed_bootstrap_user: cirros seed_vm_root_image: /opt/cache/files/cirros-0.5.2-x86_64-disk.img # Cirros doesn't load cdom drivers by default. seed_vm_configdrive_device: disk # Cirros is Debian family, but doesn't support path globs in # /etc/network/interfaces. configdrive_os_family: Debian configdrive_debian_network_interfaces_supports_glob: false # NOTE(mgoddard): CentOS 8 removes interfaces from their bridge during ifdown, # and removes the bridge if there are no interfaces left. When Kayobe bounces # veth links plugged into the bridge, it causes the bridge which has the IP we # are using for SSH to be removed. Use a dummy interface. aio_bridge_ports: - dummy1 >>>>>>> CHANGE (39b3fe CI: Use cached cirros image for seed vm job)

commit_message:
CI: display VM console log on ping or SSH failure

Also increase attempts to 12, in line with Kolla Ansible CI.

Change-Id: I81cabf27f44af3c8135efe8e427db1ffee5f0091
(cherry picked from commit 25ae0be2f914cbaefcf144f0fe20c89c8adbe1fa)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/77/780077/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <<<<<<< HEAD (a6b68e Merge "CI: use overlay2 storage driver for overcloud deploy")======= # Test SSH connectivity. For servers attached directly to the external # network, use the fixed IP. Otherwise add a floating IP. if [[ $network = provision-net ]]; then ip=$(openstack server show "$name" -f value -c addresses | sed -e "s/${network}=//") else echo "$name: Attaching floating IP" if is_ironic_enabled; then floating_net=provision-net else floating_net=public1 fi ip=$(openstack floating ip create $floating_net -f value -c floating_ip_address) openstack server add floating ip ${name} ${ip} fi echo "$name: Waiting for ping and SSH access via ${ip}" attempts=12 for i in $(seq 1 $attempts); do if ping -c1 -W1 $ip && ssh -v -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o BatchMode=yes cirros@$ip hostname; then break elif [[ $i -eq $attempts ]]; then echo "Failed to access server $name via SSH after $attempts attempts" echo "Console log:" openstack console log show ${name} return 1 else echo "Cannot access server $name - retrying" fi sleep 10 done echo "$name: Ping and SSH successful" if [[ $network != provision-net ]]; then echo "$name: Removing floating IP" openstack server remove floating ip ${name} ${ip} openstack floating ip delete ${ip} fi >>>>>>> CHANGE (25ae0b CI: display VM console log on ping or SSH failure)

commit_message:
Release final python-novaclient for Wallaby

This proposed a release for python-novaclient to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Wallaby going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Monday, March 11.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 17.3.0..54d4da11
54d4da11 Add support for microversion v2.88
e4595392 requirements: Remove simplejson
f50782f4 Uncap PrettyTable

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I47874429617678a398d3fd40aa9113dd3dbf5dc2

    "error": "Traceback (most recent call last):\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_tripleo_diff_exec_payload__m7cmu0z/ansible_tripleo_diff_exec_payload.zip/ansible/modules/tripleo_diff_exec.py\", line 123, in run\n  File \"/

commit_message:
Enforce TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE to be a string at all times

It can happen that TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE gets interpreted as a boolean
and not as a string. This has the consequence that python
when calling subprocess.run() will call os.fsencode() on the
boolean variable and we can get the following error:

    "error": "Traceback (most recent call last):\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_tripleo_diff_exec_payload__m7cmu0z/ansible_tripleo_diff_exec_payload.zip/ansible/modules/tripleo_diff_exec.py\", line 123, in run\n  File \"/
usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 423, in run\n    with Popen(*popenargs, **kwargs) as process:\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 729, in __init__\n    restore_signals, start_new_session
)\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 1275, in _execute_child\n    env_list.append(k + b'=' + os.fsencode(v))\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/os.py\", line 800, in fsencode\n    filename = fspath(f
ilename)  # Does type-checking of `filename`.\nTypeError: expected str, bytes or os.PathLike object, not bool\n",
    "invocation": {
        "module_args": {
            "command": "/var/lib/container-config-scripts/pacemaker_restart_bundle.sh cinder_volume openstack-cinder-volume openstack-cinder-volume Started",
            "environment": {
                "TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE": true
            },

Let's force it to be a string so we can never hit this.

Tested on the provided reproducer.

Change-Id: Ia4caa36a6edd865b3e1dcdf9254c7f183b64faaf
Closes-Bug: #1918111
(cherry picked from commit bdd2cfe2dfab6b7cd203211ba2adfb71a0aee27d)

commit_message:
Avoid adding implicit dep with external rsrc

Avoid adding implicit dependencies with external resources.
Make sure we not try to add implicit dependency with external resource.
Since dependencies are for make sure resources binded with the
right order, it should not link to an implicit way with external
resource.

Story: #1767149
Task: #17361

Change-Id: Ia83bd6df3e759167ae47b092ab247efe7fd0b3d4

This change to the tripleo_create_admin role adds
local:true to the create user task. This has a side
effect of idempotency to close the related bug since
it checks /etc/passwd before attempting to add the
account and so the command does not get run more than
once. This task's goal is to enable local ssh on the
system so that ansible can use the account.

Change-Id: I6dfa3d9b799ea9298cb1a59054ebd8d2e704a2ff
Closes-Bug: #1918188
"}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2021-03-09 14:52:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/92889277f1a040bf05577d7b7b0f7a2677deabfb', 'message': "Create user locally

This change to the tripleo_create_admin role adds
local:true to the create user task. This has a side
effect of idempotency to close the related bug since
it checks /etc/passwd before attempting to add the
account and so the command does not get run more than
once. This task's goal is to enable local ssh on the
system so that ansible can use the account.

Change-Id: I6dfa3d9b799ea9298cb1a59054ebd8d2e704a2ff
Closes-Bug: #1918188
"}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2021-03-10 04:44:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/3cfd57dc4a9261bd17630ad062c528896738e979', 'message': 'Create ceph-admin user with its own playbook

Calling the cli-enable-ssh-admin.yaml playbook from within
the tripleo_run_cephadm role can result in the the bug this
patch closes. Instead, create this user with a different
playbook which includes the same roles.

This change also moves a list of tasks from directly within
the cli-enable-ssh-admin.yaml playbook into a separate tasks
file (ssh_keys.yml) within the tripleo_create_admin role so
that those tasks can be more easily re-used.

Change-Id: I6dfa3d9b799ea9298cb1a59054ebd8d2e704a2ff
Closes-Bug: #1918188

commit_message:
Create ceph-admin user with its own playbook

Calling the cli-enable-ssh-admin.yaml playbook from within
the tripleo_run_cephadm role can result in the the bug this
patch closes. Instead, create this user with a different
playbook which includes the tripleo_create_admin.

Change-Id: I6dfa3d9b799ea9298cb1a59054ebd8d2e704a2ff
Closes-Bug: #1918188

commit_message:
Add batch_delete policy in resource group

Add batch_delete policy in resource group. Allow us to request
batch delete when delete a resource group. With option
`max_batch_size` and `pause_time`, we can make sure there're
enough pause time between batches.
Story: #1715398
Task: #15999

Change-Id: I16d3cf8ff19a9af60b06ecb1d009cb64aec1af58
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/76/501276/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Add `batch_delete` in update_policy for resource group. Allow us to request batch delete when delete a resource group. With option `max_batch_size` and `pause_time`, we can make sure there're enough pause time between batches and enough of number of resources triggered at same batch.

commit_message:
Disable dashboard when Masakari is not available

Change-Id: I59d91249fe4b2036c12ecca089a61937571be201
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari-dashboard refs/changes/14/777214/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_log import log as logging from masakaridashboard.api import apiLOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def allowed(self, context): # disable whole dashboard if masakari # is not present in the service catalog try: api.openstack_connection(context['request']) except Exception as e: LOG.warning(f"Failed to find suitable endpoint for Instance HA " f"service, Masakari Dashboard will not be displayed. " f"Error was: {e}") return False return super().allowed(context)

commit_message:
Reuse the docs deps to benefit from constraints

Tox trying to install latest versions for building releasenotes,
doc which may not be supported by stable and lower branches,
so should be restricted by respective version's upper-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I1b3f3a5cf20c1e7f8f419d07e382a03eea673f76

commit_message:
Finally remove the old data-utils

All active plugins now switched to new location of data-utils and
we are good to remove the old data-utils.
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-July/120086.html

One active plugin is left to merge which gate is already broken
and patch can be merged once they fix the gate.
- https://review.opendev.org/c/x/ranger-tempest-plugin/+/768760

commit_message:
Remove update_initial_state() method from the HA router

This method was intended to check state of the HA router on the
node and update it in the neutron server.
Patch [1] added check of the initial status to the
neutron_keepalived_state_change_monitor process.
It also could cause some race conditions and event which is setting
correct state of the router will be not processed thus router may endup
with two nodes with "primary" state in the Neutron's DB.

Neutron_keepalived_state_change_monitor was notifying agent about
router's initial state only if this state was 'primary'.
Now it will notify agent always to let agent set router's state as
'backup' if needed (that was previously done by this removed
update_initial_state() method).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/642295

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py
    neutron/agent/l3/keepalived_state_change.py
    neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py

Change-Id: I2cc58c30cf844ee0ecf0611ecdec430086464790
Closes-Bug: #1916022
(cherry picked from commit 0d8ae1576724b196580c9af3782fd3c9e9072bef)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-10 10:34:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/test_maintenance.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py', 'neutron/common/ovn/constants.py', 'releasenotes/notes/ovn-mcast-flood-reports-80fb529120f2af1c.yaml', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/44c367d98520cbc0cef60ce914c304918dce660b', 'message': '[OVN] Set mcast_flood_reports on LSPs

This patch enables the "mcast_flood_reports" and "mcast_flood" (on provnet
ports only) options in the Logical Switch Ports in the OVN driver. Without
these options, the ovn-controller will consume the IGMP queries and won't
send it to the LSP ports, meaning that external IGMP queries will never
arrive to the VMs.

In talks to the core OVN team, it was suggested [0] to enable the
"mcast_flood_reports" option by default in the OVN driver (at least until
fixed in core OVN) as a workaround to this problem. And, to avoid having
to update all ports (which can be many) based on the igmp_snooping_enable
configuration option, we are always setting "mcast_flood_reports" to
"true" in the LSPs. This won't cause any harm (also confirmed by core
OVN developers [0]) since it will be ignored if multicast snoop is
disabled.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1933990#c3

Closes-Bug: #1918108
Change-Id: I99a60b9af94b8208b5818b035e189822981bb269
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit b04d64b90f2822222f96ddd726d379a2f19b539e)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Set mcast_flood_reports on LSPs

This patch enables the "mcast_flood_reports" and "mcast_flood" (on provnet
ports only) options in the Logical Switch Ports in the OVN driver. Without
these options, the ovn-controller will consume the IGMP queries and won't
send it to the LSP ports, meaning that external IGMP queries will never
arrive to the VMs.

In talks to the core OVN team, it was suggested [0] to enable the
"mcast_flood_reports" option by default in the OVN driver (at least until
fixed in core OVN) as a workaround to this problem. And, to avoid having
to update all ports (which can be many) based on the igmp_snooping_enable
configuration option, we are always setting "mcast_flood_reports" to
"true" in the LSPs. This won't cause any harm (also confirmed by core
OVN developers [0]) since it will be ignored if multicast snoop is
disabled.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1933990#c3

Closes-Bug: #1918108
Change-Id: I99a60b9af94b8208b5818b035e189822981bb269
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit b04d64b90f2822222f96ddd726d379a2f19b539e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/06/779706/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(lucasagomes): Remove this in the Y cycle # A static spacing value is used here, but this method will only run # once per lock due to the use of periodics.NeverAgain(). @periodics.periodic(spacing=600, run_immediately=True) def check_for_mcast_flood_reports(self): cmds = [] for port in self._nb_idl.lsp_list().execute(check_error=True): port_type = port.type.strip() if port_type in ("vtep", "localport", "router"): continue options = port.options if ovn_const.LSP_OPTIONS_MCAST_FLOOD_REPORTS in options: continue options.update({ovn_const.LSP_OPTIONS_MCAST_FLOOD_REPORTS: 'true'}) if port_type == ovn_const.LSP_TYPE_LOCALNET: options.update({ovn_const.LSP_OPTIONS_MCAST_FLOOD: 'true'}) cmds.append(self._nb_idl.lsp_set_options(port.name, **options)) if cmds: with self._nb_idl.transaction(check_error=True) as txn: for cmd in cmds: txn.add(cmd) raise periodics.NeverAgain()

commit_message:
Synchronise kolla-ansible installation with other branches

In stable/train, installing kolla-ansible system-wide on CentOS 8 failed
with:

    ERROR: Cannot uninstall 'PyYAML'. It is a distutils installed
    project and thus we cannot accurately determine which files belong
    to it which would lead to only a partial uninstall.

This change switched to using pip --user when installing kolla-ansible,
as done in change Ifaf1948ed5d42eebaa62d7bad375bbfc12b134d5.

This is cherry-picked to stable/ussuri so that all supported branches
use similar code.

Change-Id: I4ac15e8ac4e2484e4aee0e942fabc2453a09d168
(cherry picked from commit a919fbcc3517ed355221e3d6888e6806616a40e8)

commit_message:
Fix tripleo_network config conditional

The conditional used in the NetworkConfig block always
evaluates to conclude that network config should be
applied.

Use | int filter on the slurped os-net-config return
code file so that the condition does not always evaluate
to False.

Since the molecule test is'nt working, also change it
to use the delegate driver. Create a dummy0 interface, and
change the IP addresses used to the 203.0.113.0/24
TEST-NET-3[1] range to avoid conflicts.

[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5737

Closes-Bug: #1918372
Change-Id: Ia4d663cd298556c8143eab6e799e68c81bc8235e

commit_message:
Expose 'availability_zone_hints' for OS::Neutron::Router and OS::Neutron::Net.

Since our implementation of multi-site network requires the correct availability_zone
for router and network, we are dependent on the possibility of defining the
availability_zone for a given router/network. When defining neutron objects from the
command-line, the availability_zone can be pre-determined by specifying a list of
availability_zone_hints.

This patch exposes this property within a heat-template.

Change-Id: I156314a658e6e704ee460a6e2024e6217972af7e

of rechecking every seconds before exception, completed or
timeout.
Since we use backoff retry, we don't really need to yield anything
even with PollDelay raised.
Closes-Bugs: #1725731

Change-Id: Ia39d804f9b1201aad15c39adafc77d210fcd945a

commit_message:
Support backoff retry on check resource action complete

Change to use tenacity as the retry library for check resource
completion.
Use exponential backoff retry waiting time to reduce the tension
of rechecking every seconds before exception, completed or
timeout.
Since we use backoff retry, we don't really need to yield anything
even with PollDelay raised.
Closes-Bugs: #1725731

Change-Id: Ia39d804f9b1201aad15c39adafc77d210fcd945a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/54/513954/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import tenacity class wait_random_exponential(tenacity.wait_exponential): """Random wait strategy with a geometrically increasing amount of jitter. Implements the truncated binary exponential backoff algorithm as used in e.g. CSMA media access control. The retry occurs at a random time in a (geometrically) expanding interval constrained by minimum and maximum limits. """ def __init__(self, min=0, multiplier=1, max=tenacity._utils.MAX_WAIT, exp_base=2): super(wait_random_exponential, self).__init__(multiplier=multiplier, max=(max-min), exp_base=exp_base) self._random = tenacity.wait_random(min=min, max=(min + multiplier)) def __call__(self, previous_attempt_number, delay_since_first_attempt): jitter = super(wait_random_exponential, self).__call__(previous_attempt_number, delay_since_first_attempt) self._random.wait_random_max = self._random.wait_random_min + jitter return self._random(previous_attempt_number, delay_since_first_attempt) class retry_if_result_and_execption(object): """Retries if an execption or result verifies a predicate.""" def __init__(self, result_predicate, execption_predicate): self.result_predicate = result_predicate self.execption_predicate = execption_predicate def __call__(self, attempt): if attempt.failed: return self.execption_predicate(attempt.exception()) return self.result_predicate(attempt.result()) def __and__(self, other): return tenacity.retry_all(self, other) def __or__(self, other): return tenacity.retry_any(self, other)

commit_message:
Refactor heat integration tests infra

devstack supports a 'test-conig' setup phase where it can setup tempest
and its config appropriately.

Move the code from prepare_test_env.sh and prepare_test_network.sh
directly into a heat's devstack plugin function that will be called
in that phase.
Couple of new devstack plugin settings are introduced as a side effect.

Change-Id: I6e70c81b9388880e00e1eccb3de634e89317289e

commit_message:
[L3] Delete DvrFipGatewayPortAgentBindings after no gw ports

This is the code behavior aligning for dvr related logical. The
L3 dvr DB will remove all related FIP agent gateway port after there
is no real use of it. But the DvrFipGatewayPortAgentBindings remain,
it will cause the issue of new floating IP failed to bind. This
patch adds the binding deleting action.

Related-bug: #1883089
Change-Id: I62c29e172bc8705dade11d37bb347241ef8ad5f8
(cherry picked from commit 8dee0d9a4eb4282b989f2c77a79e55aa89554788)

commit_message:
Delete the snapshot images when delete server

To delete the snapshot images when delete the server
resource, to make sure the snapshot images won't left.

Change-Id: I46cc26c4786b08f3197da7328f319bcfb91f8b8e
Closes-Bug: #1716845
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/62/504862/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heat.objects import snapshot as snapshot_object def _get_snapshot_images(self): snapshot_images = [] snapshots = snapshot_object.Snapshot.get_all( self.context, self.stack.id) for snapshot in snapshots: if snapshot.data: data = snapshot.data['resources'].get(self.name) if data and self.resource_id == data['resource_id']: image_id = data['resource_data'].get('snapshot_image_id') if image_id: snapshot_images.append(image_id) return snapshot_images def _delete_snapshot_images(self): snapshot_images = self._get_snapshot_images() for snapshot_image in snapshot_images: try: self.client('glance').images.delete(snapshot_image) except Exception as e: LOG.warning('Cannot delete the snapshot image %(image)s for ' '%(server)s: %(error)s.', {'image': snapshot_image, 'server': self.resource_id, 'error': six.text_type(e)}) # remove the snapshot images of the server self._delete_snapshot_images()

commit_message:
Add qos_policy property to floatingip resource

neutron has enabled floating-ip-rate-limit[1]
this enable to create floatingip and set bandwith in qos_policy

[1]:https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/floating-ip-rate-limit
Change-Id: I6a9bccc8d6f918cf73d521499aa494ee9144448c

commit_message:
Add validation for resource name arg to functions

Now StackValidation fail error with corresponding path is
returned to user in the case if resource_name argument to
get_attr or get_resource functions has incorrect type.

Change-Id: I1996162dc0d19173666ba71d9d2b39bece2e5788
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/33/334533/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_attr_invalid_res_name(self): """Test resolution of get_attr occurrences in HOT template.""" hot_tpl = hot_tpl_generic_resource self.stack = parser.Stack(self.ctx, 'test_get_attr', template.Template(hot_tpl)) self.stack.store() self.stack.create() self.assertEqual((parser.Stack.CREATE, parser.Stack.COMPLETE), self.stack.state) self.assertRaises(TypeError, self.resolve, {'Value': {'get_attr': [{}, 'NotThere']}}) def test_get_resource_bad_argument(self): """Test resolution of get_resource occurrences in HOT template.""" hot_tpl = hot_tpl_generic_resource self.stack = parser.Stack(self.ctx, 'test_get_resource', template.Template(hot_tpl)) self.stack.store() self.stack.create() self.assertEqual((parser.Stack.CREATE, parser.Stack.COMPLETE), self.stack.state) snippet = {'value': {'get_resource': {}}} self.assertRaises(TypeError, self.resolve, snippet)

subject: Handle network property for Server on cancel-update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-30 09:57:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/175ce7eb5f9fe3f42c456d4b62639b4feda6029f', 'message': "Handle network property for Server on cancel-update

This patch add special logic for handling network properties for server
resource during replace. Previously cancel update for Server resource
with specified network property failed due to attempt to attach
interface deleted by nova (because ports created by nova, will be
deleted during detach interface).

This patch has check for convergence enable, because for convergence we
execute rollback from old resource, but for legacy code it's different.

commit_message:
Handle network property for Server on cancel-update

This patch add special logic for handling network properties for server
resource during replace. Previously cancel update for Server resource
with specified network property failed due to attempt to attach
interface deleted by nova (because ports created by nova, will be
deleted during detach interface).

Related-Bug: #1570908

Change-Id: Ice6c7d839aae249e55cfe4814509e617aeae4e6d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/49/415849/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: self.client_plugin().interface_attach(prev_server_id, port['id']) prev_server_id, port['id']): % {'port': port['id'], port=port['id'], server=prev_server_id)

subject: Fix cache storing problem
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-07 11:44:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/a28f8d958d43190fd5b8bb88ac58254a6a3e4d7b', 'message': 'Fix cache storing problem

This patch fixes situation where:
1. Stack A created.
2. Stack B which uses resources from stack A
(referenced by name or id) is created.
3. Both stacks are deleted.
4. Stack C created with same resource names as in Stack A.
5. Stack D created which uses resources from stack C.
6. Creation of stack D is failed due to the fact
that cache still contains old values from stack A.

Now, when cacheable resource is deleted it also
invalidates (clears) its cache.

Also, cache backend is changed from dogpile.cache.memory to
dogpile.cache.memcached.
Using of Memory backend is discouraged
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.cache/blob/master/oslo_cache/testing.py#L39-L47
With Memory backend cache behaves strange with convergence enabled
(and approach used in this patch will not fix the bug without
changing cache backend).

Closes-bug: #1609787
Change-Id: I8a0790f0f7c62e1727b144628da97006c3c9679e

commit_message:
Fix cache storing problem

This patch fixes situation where:
1. Stack A created.
2. Stack B which uses resources from stack A
(referenced by name or id) is created.
3. Both stacks are deleted.
4. Stack C created with same resource names as in Stack A.
5. Stack D created which uses resources from stack C.
6. Creation of stack D is failed due to the fact
that cache still contains old values from stack A.

Now, when cacheable resource is deleted it also
invalidates (clears) its cache.

Also, cache backend is changed from dogpile.cache.memory to
dogpile.cache.memcached.
Using of Memory backend is discouraged
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.cache/blob/master/oslo_cache/testing.py#L39-L47
With Memory backend cache behaves strange with convergence enabled
(and approach used in this patch will not fix the bug without
changing cache backend).

Cache clear occurs only if cache set to enabled in heat.conf

Closes-bug: #1609787
Change-Id: I8a0790f0f7c62e1727b144628da97006c3c9679e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/96/366696/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow a stack with invalid resolved properties to be updated

Whenever a stack has a resource with a property that resolves to an
incorrect type, we should still be able to update the stack with a
valid template.

Change-Id: Ic22c4c61019db85dd0f06e592f0653b38e327560
Closes-Bug: #1588431
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/98/324898/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_stack_update_from_failed_resolve_invalid_type(self): """Test for bug 1588431. Whenever a stack has a resource with a property that resolves to an incorrect type, we should be able to update the stack with a valid template. """ invalid_template = ''' heat_template_version: 2013-05-23 resources: random-string-cluster: type: OS::Heat::ResourceGroup properties: count: 4 resource_def: type: OS::Heat::RandomString single-random-string: type: OS::Heat::RandomString properties: length: str_replace: params: foo: {get_attr: [random-string-cluster, value]} template: | foo1 ''' valid_template = ''' heat_template_version: 2013-05-23 resources: random-string-cluster: type: OS::Heat::ResourceGroup properties: count: 4 resource_def: type: OS::Heat::RandomString single-random-string: type: OS::Heat::RandomString properties: length: 8 ''' stack_identifier = self.stack_create(template=invalid_template, expected_status='CREATE_FAILED') self.update_stack(stack_identifier, template=valid_template, expected_status='UPDATE_COMPLETE')

commit_message:
Don't set stack to FAILED if rollback enable

Don't set stack to FAILED before stack rollback,
to avoid the stack_resource check update fail.

Change-Id: I0c1723ef2e0766fa69b887c74addcef4c1a22227
Closes-Bug: #1693985

commit_message:
Update defn of resource if its update cancelled

If cancel came in the middle of update handler task,
the resource was updated partially, so update the
defn to prepare for rollback.

Change-Id: Id5e56a3214e241817ae4a6cb5518a58a9fe12f91
Closes-Bug: #1693495

commit_message:
Support to boot nova server with tags

Before this patch we set tags for server after
the server created complete, since microversion 2.52
nova supports to boot server with tags, so we
can change the logic of tags setting.

Change-Id: I2e9456bf0a39ca305125075c6aaddd74b8fe5d9c
Closes-Bug: #1708384

commit_message:
update scenario.test_server_signal to use config

Update the heat_integrationtests.scenario.test_server_signal
test cases to make proper use of the heat_plugin
tempest configuration options:

   - use the conf.instance_type flavor in the
   test_server_signal_userdata_format_software_config instead
   of the conf.minimal_instance_type flavor
   - use the conf.floating_network_name network instead of
   the default 'public' network harcoded in the template file
   - use the conf.fixed_network_name network instead of
   the default 'heat-net' network harcoded in the template file

Change-Id: I9e2536189804c9a33db109cc0c2baa88c3fcf7c6
Closes-Bug: #1708668
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/85/490885/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support 'tag' for device matadata tag

Nova supports device metadata tag since version 2.32.
This patch will support it in heat.
Change-Id: I00e9d7bbee62483a8a916a212d39218ab0d95a7c
Closes-Bug: #1657672

subject: Add root_id column to stack table
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-12 09:49:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/5e78c2620dc0913b16ed470bf02f3e9a0aec50d7', 'message': "Add root_id column to stack table

Before this patch, calls to Stack.get_root_id() ended up performing a
recursive db operation with as many calls as the depth of the (nested)
stack. This is mainly invoked when resources are created; if there
are 100 resources at an average stack depth of 20, that's about 2000
more db calls than we ought to need. With this patch, none of those
calls are necessary.

This patch also helps with quickly counting total resources
from anywhere within the nested stack.

Change-Id: I09b79e96900544e8633e7052ea21799502d18d4d
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-12 19:42:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/30b5a89871c1a0343fadeb85ff66c3da6ac1b5cd', 'message': "Add root_id column to stack table

Before this patch, calls to Stack.get_root_id() ended up performing a
recursive db operation with as many calls as the depth of the (nested)
stack. This is mainly invoked when resources are created; if there
are 100 resources at an average stack depth of 20, that's about 2000
more db calls than we ought to need. With this patch, none of those
calls are necessary.

This patch also helps with quickly counting total resources
from anywhere within the nested stack.

Change-Id: I09b79e96900544e8633e7052ea21799502d18d4d

commit_message:
Add root_id column to stack table

Before this patch, calls to Stack.get_root_id() ended up performing a
recursive db operation with as many calls as the depth of the (nested)
stack. This is mainly invoked when resources are created; if there
are 100 resources at an average stack depth of 20, that's about 2000
more db calls than we ought to need. With this patch, none of those
calls are necessary.

Change-Id: I09b79e96900544e8633e7052ea21799502d18d4d
Story: #1677901
Task: 17225

commit_message:
Enable redelegation feature

When the reauthentication_auth_method = true, the openstack
resource component to create_trust has a 403 error.  For
example, Sahara creates a new trust using heat_trust_token
has a 403 error. Need to specify allow_redelegation=True
when heat creates trust.

Change-Id: I3667e3de2f2d574d3991742922a7401cc18b9081
Related-Bug: #1717918
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/76/505476/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Update auth_uri option and port 35357
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-22 12:17:44.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install/install-ubuntu.rst', 'doc/source/install/install-obs.rst', 'doc/source/install/install-rdo.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/28ff9690e237dafff999f737bf4226d01d8f9b87', 'message': 'Update auth_uri option and port 35357

This option is deprecated for removal since Queens.[1]
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

Before the Queens release,
keystone needed to be run on two separate ports to accommodate the Identity v2 API
which ran a separate admin-only service commonly on port 35357.
With the removal of the v2 API, keystone can be run on the same port for all interfaces.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I1033651db70c0a55231e436e907be232569e039f
'}]
commit_message:
Update auth_uri option and port 35357

This option is deprecated for removal since Queens.[1]
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

Before the Queens release,
keystone needed to be run on two separate ports to accommodate the Identity v2 API
which ran a separate admin-only service commonly on port 35357.
With the removal of the v2 API, keystone can be run on the same port for all interfaces.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I1033651db70c0a55231e436e907be232569e039f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/68/612368/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: www_authenticate_uri = http://controller:5000 auth_url = http://controller:5000 auth_url = http://controller:5000 www_authenticate_uri = http://controller:5000
deleted_lines: auth_uri = http://controller:5000 auth_url = http://controller:35357 auth_url = http://controller:35357 auth_uri = http://controller:5000

commit_message:
Add vision-reflection document

Change-Id: I9154c9ccb23b6409bc58498d42a1dbd50d3b8187
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/79/648479/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================= Vision Reflection ================= In late-2018, the OpenStack Technical Committee composed a `technical vision <https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/technical-vision.html>`_ of what OpenStack clouds should look like. This document compares the state of heat relative to that vision to provide some guidance on broad stroke ways in which heat may need to change to match the vision. The Pillars of Cloud ==================== Self-service ------------ During orchestrate a Heat stack in user have the ability to build a self-service cluster with even auto-healing and auto-scaling ability. With proper setup, application should be able to achieve fully automatic. Also, Heat is multi-tenancy service allow users from different projects can isolated their resource accesses between each other (but not for global admin). As for quotas management, Heat still possible to hit quota limit. For example, when rollback from a Update fail. We will prioritize resource action and give delete old(failed) resource first before recreate it again. But there's no guarantee to said the order will nerver hit quota limit. Application Control ------------------- With Heat multiple resource types, you can achieve fully application control. The limit would be you have to be able to choosing endpoint types (public, internal, etc.) you're using to access to OpenStack services. But in certain cases, Heat only provide application with default internal type (which we're plan to fix soon). OpenStack-specific Considerations ================================= Interoperability ---------------- For OpenStack-specific, Heat already officially mark as extend for OpenStack certified with validated interoperability. There still some following task to do, but that statement is already true. Bidirectional Compatibility --------------------------- Current Heat support interact with multiple OpenStack cloud in single orchestration stack (with nested stack structure). If template not compatable in local or remote site, it will fail gracefully, mark action failed, and show user the failure reason. Heat API only got V1 now, which we try hard to keep it backward compatable. Still we not support microversion yet, so user can't tell easily what kind of new features they can use by checking their API version through API call. Cross-Project Dependencies -------------------------- Heat mainly depend on Keystone for all authZ and authN. For other services, it's all soft dependencies depends on what resource type user wish to use in their own environment. For some specific heat features may require their own soft dependencies. Like multiple OpenStack cloud support needs Barbican support to store secret. But they all optional. If the dependencies can't be satisified, Heat should be able to fail gracefully. Partitioning ------------ Heat provide stacks and resources mostly base on project scope, and rely on other services to provide detail partitioning. Like we allow set Availability Zone (AZ) for Nova Instance by pass AZ to Nova. And base on this design, Heat shouldn't need to setup more further partitioning. Users are allow to group resources by group type of resources or use nested stack. However, their's no simple way to regroup existing resources. Design Goals ============ Basic Physical Data Center Management ------------------------------------- Plays Well With Others ---------------------- Hardware Virtualisation ----------------------- Infinite, Continuous Scaling ---------------------------- Built-in Reliability and Durability ----------------------------------- Customisable Integration ------------------------ Abstract Specialised Operations ------------------------------- Graphical User Interface ------------------------

commit_message:
Allow to specify a different region for the domain admin client

In a multi-region setup with a master Keystone and slaves replicating
user tables, Heat must create users in the master region to avoid
triggering replication failures.

Change-Id: I6b7911f7698502e3548bd40e91e5bff709232bec
Story: 2005653
Task: 30941

subject: Fix live-migration with libvirt >= 6.8.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-10 15:39:37.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/nova_compute_live_migration_force_nc-f903a09955164ad9.yaml', 'manifests/profile/base/nova/migration/client.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/bf5a4a9849d7cb067d36ca57fd8538faed016715', 'message': 'Fix live-migration with libvirt >= 6.8.0

libvirt 6.8.0 introduces virt-ssh-helper which prepends the libvirt
ssh command with a "which virt-ssh-helper". libvirt used to first
check for `nc` (netcat). But these two libvirt commits[1][2] have now
changed it to first look for `virt-ssh-helper`, if it not available,
then fall back to `nc`.

The nova-migration-wrapper doesn't accept this command and denies
the connection.

Until nova-migration-wrapper is changed to allow the usage of
virt-ssh-helper, this change force to use "netcat" (`nc`) by
appending to the migration URI: "&proxy=netcat"

[1] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=f8ec7c842d (rpc:
use new virt-ssh-helper binary for remote tunnelling, 2020-07-08)
[2] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=7d959c302d (rpc:
Fix virt-ssh-helper detection, 2020-10-27)

Closes-Bug: 1918250

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1926602

Change-Id: I3db9cd42aa63379ed6332ee77f67d1dfe4be8504
Co-Authored-By: David Vallee Delisle <dvd@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 04a97f92e4d944ce51492011584e2ec1126042a1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix live-migration with libvirt >= 6.8.0

libvirt 6.8.0 introduces virt-ssh-helper which prepends the libvirt
ssh command with a "which virt-ssh-helper". libvirt used to first
check for `nc` (netcat). But these two libvirt commits[1][2] have now
changed it to first look for `virt-ssh-helper`, if it not available,
then fall back to `nc`.

The nova-migration-wrapper doesn't accept this command and denies
the connection.

Until nova-migration-wrapper is changed to allow the usage of
virt-ssh-helper, this change force to use "netcat" (`nc`) by
appending to the migration URI: "&proxy=netcat"

[1] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=f8ec7c842d (rpc:
use new virt-ssh-helper binary for remote tunnelling, 2020-07-08)
[2] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=7d959c302d (rpc:
Fix virt-ssh-helper detection, 2020-10-27)

Closes-Bug: 1918250

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1926602

Change-Id: I3db9cd42aa63379ed6332ee77f67d1dfe4be8504
Co-Authored-By: David Vallee Delisle <dvd@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 04a97f92e4d944ce51492011584e2ec1126042a1)

commit_message:
Add flake8-import-order extension

This adds the import order extension to match what we have in the cinder
repo. This is a linting extension that will check that imports are in
the correct order and the correct grouping so they automatically get
flagged, and it won't be whether reviewers notice and decide to do
anything or not.

Cinder change was Ic13ba238a4a45c6219f4de131cfe0366219d722f for a little
more wordy reasoning.

Also includes updates for noqa tags. Newer version of the linters appear
to want these on the function definition line, not on the decorator
line.

Change-Id: Ibf3f3afbf3bb6ec6613b35f91d4a353c6a391f41
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Seed the pseudo-random generator on service start

The heat engine uses random.randint() / random.uniform() to
introduce non-determenism in some retry/backoff functionality.

To avoid that every instance (which is likely started
at the same time) in a cluster installation runs with the same
seed, seed it on startup.

Change-Id: I203d0c77a6fc702137d1457a38aaa367d18e0bea

commit_message:
Add initialization stack action

Allows users to initialize a stack without allocating resources. This
allows users to launch a stack at a future time by simply calling update
on the stack or for intigration into a reservation service like Blazar
to launch stack when a node reservations begin

Change-Id: Ie05b248a7270ac4d6d08a9b8accec7dd79b8ac12
Story: 2005652
Task: 30940

commit_message:
Dropping explicit unicode literal

In python 3, all strings are considered as unicode string.

This patch drops the explicit unicode literal (u'...')
or (u"..") appearances from the unicode strings.

Change-Id: I9902966892a1dc4f85d449dfe580fb128647487b

commit_message:
GroupUserAssignment Resource: The resource adds users to a group

Change-Id: If73ab29f1f2a99fb3b544362679757ffb8fa2574
Story: 2005795
Task: 33522
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/06/662206/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from heat.common import exception from heat.common.i18n import _ from heat.engine import constraints from heat.engine import properties from heat.engine import resource from heat.engine import support from keystoneclient import exceptions as keystone_exceptions class KeystoneUserAssignmentMixin(object): """Implements user assignment to group. heat_template_version: 2013-05-23 parameters: ... Group parameters user1_name: type: string description: user1 name user1_domain: type: string description: user1 domain user2_name: type: string description: user2 name user2_domain: type: string description: user2 domain resources: group_user_assignments: type: OS::Keystone::GroupUserAssignment properties: ... Group properties users: - name: {get_param: user1_name} user_domain: {get_param: user1_domain} - name: {get_param: user2_name} user_domain: {get_param: user2_domain} """ PROPERTIES = ( USERS ) = ( 'users' ) _USERS_MAPPING_PROPERTIES = ( NAME, USER_DOMAIN ) = ( 'name', 'user_domain' ) mixin_properties_schema = { USERS: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.LIST, _('List of users.'), schema=properties.Schema( properties.Schema.MAP, _('Map between user with user name and user domain.'), schema={ NAME: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('User Name.'), required=True, constraints=([constraints. CustomConstraint('keystone.user')]) ), USER_DOMAIN: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('User keystone domain.'), constraints=([constraints. CustomConstraint('keystone.domain')]) ), } ), update_allowed=True ) } def _add_user_assignments_to_group(self, group_id, user_assignments): for user_assignment in self._normalize_to_id(user_assignments): if group_id is not None: user_id = None try: user_id = self.client_plugin().get_user_id( user_assignment.get(self.NAME), domain=user_assignment.get(self.USER_DOMAIN)) except Exception as ex: self.client_plugin().ignore_not_found(ex) return None if user_id: self.client().users.add_to_group(user_id, group_id) def _remove_user_assignments_from_group(self, group_id, user_assignments): try: for user_assignment in self._normalize_to_id(user_assignments): if group_id is not None: user_id = None try: user_id = self.client_plugin().get_user_id( user_assignment.get(self.NAME), domain=user_assignment.get(self.USER_DOMAIN)) except Exception as ex: self.client_plugin().ignore_not_found(ex) return None if user_id: self.client().users.remove_from_group(user_id, group_id) except (exception.NotFound, keystone_exceptions.NotFound): pass def _normalize_to_id(self, user_assignment_prps): user_assignments = [] if user_assignment_prps is None: return user_assignments for user_assignment in user_assignment_prps: name = user_assignment.get(self.NAME) user_domain = user_assignment.get(self.USER_DOMAIN) user_domain_id = (self.client_plugin().get_domain_id( user_domain)) if user_domain else None user_assignments.append({ self.NAME: self.client_plugin(). get_user_id(name, domain=user_domain_id), self.USER_DOMAIN: user_domain_id }) return user_assignments def _find_differences(self, updated_prps, stored_prps): updated_user_group_assignments = [] # Split the properties into two set of role assignments # (project, domain) from updated properties for user_assignment in updated_prps or []: if user_assignment.get(self.NAME) is not None: updated_user_group_assignments.append( '%s:%s' % ( user_assignment[self.NAME], user_assignment[self.USER_DOMAIN])) stored_user_group_assignments = [] # Split the properties into two set of role assignments # (project, domain) from updated properties for user_assignment in (stored_prps or []): if user_assignment.get(self.NAME) is not None: stored_user_group_assignments.append( '%s:%s' % ( user_assignment[self.NAME], user_assignment[self.USER_DOMAIN])) new_user_assignments = [] removed_user_assignments = [] # NOTE: finding the diff of list of strings is easier by using 'set' # so properties are converted to string in above sections # New items for item in (set(updated_user_group_assignments) - set(stored_user_group_assignments)): new_user_assignments.append( {self.NAME: item[:item.find(':')], self.USER_DOMAIN: item[item.find(':') + 1:]} ) # Old items for item in (set(stored_user_group_assignments) - set(updated_user_group_assignments)): removed_user_assignments.append( {self.NAME: item[:item.find(':')], self.USER_DOMAIN: item[item.find(':') + 1:]} ) return new_user_assignments, removed_user_assignments def create_assignment(self, group_id=None): if self.properties.get(self.USERS) is not None: if group_id is not None: self._add_user_assignments_to_group( group_id, self.properties.get(self.USERS)) def update_assignment(self, prop_diff, group_id=None, group_domain=None): # if there is no change do not update if self.USERS in prop_diff: (new_user_assignments, removed_user_assignments) = self._find_differences( prop_diff.get(self.USERS), self.properties[self.USERS]) if len(new_user_assignments) > 0: if group_id is not None: self._add_user_assignments_to_group( group_id, new_user_assignments) if len(removed_user_assignments) > 0: if group_id is not None: self._remove_user_assignments_from_group( group_id, removed_user_assignments) def delete_assignment(self, group_id=None): self._stored_properties_data if self.properties[self.USERS] is not None: if group_id is not None: self._remove_user_assignments_from_group( group_id, (self.properties[self.USERS])) def validate_assignment_properties(self): if self.properties.get(self.USERS) is not None: for user_assignment in self.properties.get(self.USERS): name = user_assignment.get(self.NAME) if name is None: msg = _('Name must be specified for %s group' ' assignment') % user_assignment.get(self) raise exception.StackValidationFailed(message=msg) class KeystoneGroupUserAssignment(resource.Resource, KeystoneUserAssignmentMixin): """Resource for assigning users to a group. Resource for specifying group and it's users. """ support_status = support.SupportStatus( version='5.0.0', message=_('Supported versions: keystone v3')) default_client_name = 'keystone' PROPERTIES = ( GROUP, GROUP_DOMAIN ) = ( 'group', 'group_domain' ) properties_schema = { GROUP: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('Name or id of keystone group.'), required=True, update_allowed=True, constraints=[constraints.CustomConstraint('keystone.group')] ), GROUP_DOMAIN: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('Name or id of keystone domain.'), required=True, update_allowed=True, constraints=[constraints.CustomConstraint('keystone.domain')] ) } properties_schema.update( KeystoneUserAssignmentMixin.mixin_properties_schema) def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(KeystoneGroupUserAssignment, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) def client(self): return super(KeystoneGroupUserAssignment, self).client().client @property def group_id(self): try: return self.client_plugin().get_group_id( self.properties.get(self.GROUP), domain=self.group_domain_id) except Exception as ex: self.client_plugin().ignore_not_found(ex) return None @property def group_domain_id(self): try: return self.client_plugin().get_domain_id( self.properties.get(self.GROUP_DOMAIN)) except Exception as ex: self.client_plugin().ignore_not_found(ex) return None def handle_create(self): self.create_assignment(group_id=self.group_id) def handle_update(self, json_snippet, tmpl_diff, prop_diff): self.update_assignment(group_id=self.group_id, prop_diff=prop_diff) def handle_delete(self): self.delete_assignment(group_id=self.group_id) def validate(self): super(KeystoneGroupUserAssignment, self).validate() self.validate_assignment_properties() def resource_mapping(): return { 'OS::Keystone::GroupUserAssignment': KeystoneGroupUserAssignment }

commit_message:
change log level

as is : LOG.exception(...) does not match pep8 standard.
to be : use LOG.debug(...)

Change-Id: Ibc60c19cae06a27af25be83963e20e8b7c102dab

subject: Validate signal/message transport
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-11 14:29:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/8d9c9e66a347b00fe6d675d3b23b7b1c98fe7da9', 'message': 'Validate signal/message transport

Some values for signal transport depend on external service being
available (Swift, Zaqar) but are not being validated. This leads to
late failures during the stack creation, and what is more, such failed
stacks might become non-deletable.

This patch adds validaiton of provided signal transports to the
resources that have such properties (HeatWaitConditionHandle, Server,
SofwareDeployment).

Change-Id: Ib3041c9e61b44c19d2d0aa10fcd3951baebdea57
Closes-Bug: #1542269

commit_message:
Validate signal/message transport

Some values for signal transport depend on external service being
available (Swift, Zaqar) but are not being validated. This leads to
late failures during the stack creation, and what is more, such failed
stacks might become non-deletable.

This patch adds validaiton of provided signal transports to the
resources that have such properties (HeatWaitConditionHandle, Server,
SofwareDeployment).

Change-Id: Ib3041c9e61b44c19d2d0aa10fcd3951baebdea57
Closes-Bug: #1542269

commit_message:
Fix floatingip dependencies building

Add dependencies to router interface except such cases:

1. Floating ip doesn't set port property.
2. If router interface depends on some port with fixed_ips property in
   it and fip has port with defined fixed_ips, we can compare both
   fixed_ips lists and decide whether we need to add dependencies or not.

Both string values or dependencies on other resources can be in these
lists. In other cases we can't be sure and need to call neutron.
However, dependencies should be calculated fast and should not call any
external API, so in another situations we just assume, that we should
add dependencies.

Because of removed call to neutron, this fixes one more bug.

Closes-Bug: #1629929
Closes-Bug: #1626634
Change-Id: I688c399dd1589a80f990d0bf351a68090f56b264

commit_message:
WIP: Imporve update preview logic

Current update preview logic might display not accurate information.
In case you try update preview along with the same template what you
used for the stack creation, and also the resource including
get_resource or other dependecy functions, you might get unexpected
result indicationg the resources will be updated even though you
didn't have any change for the template.

Change-Id: I7a12c6f16cf62589f9c199ec08f66c40e3dcd22f
Closes-Bug: #1691786

commit_message:
Remove sudoers injection part of the heat boot scripts

The ability to customize the instance_user was removed
in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/103928/ so we can
remove the remaining code that looks slightly scary
in touching sudoers dynamically.

Related-Bug: #1257410
Change-Id: Ia98b49678af192a09812126ba33dfead34d7ef75

commit_message:
Improve curl download

- Add -f and -S option to see the actual error
- Combined all options at one
- Increased number of retries to 5

Change-Id: Idc399f75f0abdb1ff91e785a738dce256fb6c281

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from heatclient import exc from oslo_log import log as logging import six from heat_integrationtests.functional import functional_base LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class ExternalRefTest(functional_base.FunctionalTestsBase): def setUp(self): super(ExternalRefTest, self).setUp() def _external_rsrc_create(self, stack_id, ref_stack_status): temp_ex_ref_stack = ''' heat_template_version: newton resources: ext_stack: type: OS::Heat::Stack external_id: %s outputs: str: value: {get_resource: ext_stack} ''' % stack_id ex = self.assertRaises( exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.stack_create, template=temp_ex_ref_stack) error_msg = ('ERROR: Invalid external resource: Resource %s ' '(OS::Heat::Stack) is under %s') % ( stack_id, ref_stack_status) self.assertEqual(error_msg, six.text_type(ex)) def test_create_external_ref_to_failed_stack(self): template_failed = ''' heat_template_version: newton resources: test1: type: OS::Heat::TestResource properties: fail: True ''' stack_id = self.stack_create(template=template_failed, expected_status='CREATE_FAILED') expected_resources = {'test1': 'OS::Heat::TestResource'} self.assertEqual(expected_resources, self.list_resources(stack_id)) self._external_rsrc_create(stack_id, 'CREATE_FAILED') def test_create_external_ref_to_deleted_stack(self): template = ''' heat_template_version: newton resources: test1: type: OS::Heat::TestResource ''' stack_id = self.stack_create(template=template, expected_status='CREATE_COMPLETE') expected_resources = {'test1': 'OS::Heat::TestResource'} self.assertEqual(expected_resources, self.list_resources(stack_id)) self._stack_delete(stack_id) self._external_rsrc_create(stack_id, 'DELETE_COMPLETE') def test_create_external_ref_to_in_progress_stack(self): template = ''' heat_template_version: newton resources: test1: type: OS::Heat::TestResource properties: action_wait_secs: create: 15 ''' stack_id = self.stack_create(template=template, expected_status='CREATE_IN_PROGRESS') self._external_rsrc_create(stack_id, 'CREATE_IN_PROGRESS')

commit_message:
Add hirsute and remove trusty from metadata.yaml

This update adds the new hirsute Ubuntu release (21.04) and
removes trusty support (14.04 which is EOL at 21.04).

Change-Id: If0b6b73e75e51230f6b3330754c12b9ad10540f8

commit_message:
[stable] Drop lower-constraints job

As discussed in neutron team meeting [1], it is not worth fixing issues
identified by new pip resolver in stable branches. So let's drop the job

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/networking/2021/networking.2021-01-12-14.00.log.html#l-164

For stein branch, sync pylint test-requirements with neutron ones, as
current ones would require newer astroid (spotted with new pip
resolver). Also update psutil functional test requirement (syncing with
neutron stein version), as detected by new pip resolver.

Conflicts:
	lower-constraints.txt
	zuul.d/project.yaml

Change-Id: I96c59b2e6697d65184e87b731682fd7441519c89
(cherry picked from commit d07317b60e6d46aabc3a6e878924923a07661e75)

commit_message:
ansible-lint: add unnamed-task to the skip list

The 5.0.3 release of ansible-lint makes the linters job fail, due to the
addition of an unnamed-task rule. We have quite a large number of
unnamed tasks, typically include_tasks or include_role. We may want to
address this at some point, but not right now.

Change-Id: I4ee706fe2463d62e4e16412117d4373748ea43e3
(cherry picked from commit 32f1b6cf56f3e9678b909e0f7ca3922c3bc44f79)

commit_message:
Part 6 - Add RBAC protection tests

This change enforces API policy
scenarios with unit testing and ddt.
It uses keystone middleware unlike
existing policy tests that use the
noauth middleware.

These tests should serve as protection
tests when making policy/API changes.

This change adds tests for the following
API groups:
- shares (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
- share replicas (GET, POST, DELETE)
- share types (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
- share type extra specs (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)

Change-Id: I6e6cbe66af177af79514c37a4748429744255d0c
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

status='available') other_project_snapshot = db_utils.create_snapshot( project_id=other_project_id, share_id=other_project_share['id'], status='available') project_access_rule = db_utils.create_access( share_id=project_share['id'])['id'] other_project_access_rule = db_utils.create_access( share_id=other_project_share['id'])['id'] self.substitutions = { 'project_share': project_share['id'], 'other_project_share': other_project_share['id'], 'deletable_project_share': deletable_project_share['id'], 'deletable_other_project_share': deletable_other_project_share['id'], 'migrating_project_share': migrating_project_share['id'], 'migrating_other_project_share': migrating_other_project_share['id'], 'project_snapshot': project_snapshot['id'], 'other_project_snapshot': other_project_snapshot['id'], 'project_access_rule': project_access_rule, 'other_project_access_rule': other_project_access_rule, } self.mock_object(quota.QUOTAS, 'reserve') self.mock_object(quota.QUOTAS, 'commit') self.mock_object(db_api, 'service_get_by_args', mock.Mock( return_value={'availability_zone_id': 'test'})) self.mock_object(utils, 'service_is_up') self.mock_object(utils, 'validate_service_host') @ddt.file_data('legacy_rbac/share.yaml') @ddt.unpack def test_share(self, path, method, expected_status, **kw): path = Template(path).safe_substitute(**self.substitutions) revert_snapshot = kw.get( 'body', {}).get('revert', {}).get('snapshot_id') deny_access_rule = kw.get( 'body', {}).get('deny_access', {}).get('access_id') if revert_snapshot: kw['body']['revert']['snapshot_id'] = Template( revert_snapshot).safe_substitute(**self.substitutions) if deny_access_rule: kw['body']['deny_access']['access_id'] = Template( deny_access_rule).safe_substitute(**self.substitutions) self.do_request(method, path, expected_status, **kw)

commit_message:
jobs: remove devstack-gate references

Not needed by native Zuul v3 jobs.

Conflicts:
        zuul.d/tempest-singlenode.yaml
The conflicts are due to the evolution of the jobs definition
(a new job was added after victoria, and other changes).

Change-Id: Ia1e7d35f0c81cc5df792f4227d8e091080af65f1
(cherry picked from commit 2bb4f5defde2f9aac4280849efc03f26a2f94fc7)

commit_message:
Add hirsute and remove trusty from metadata.yaml

This update adds the new hirsute Ubuntu release (21.04) and
removes trusty support (14.04 which is EOL at 21.04).

Change-Id: I3a3d48f01a74c6fdfbee0463718c87e5863bc2d4

commit_message:
Fix Remove revoked ceph apt-keys

when running the playbook it does appens that the apt_key task fails.
let's retry in case of failure to mimic the apt-key add that runs later.

Change-Id: Ie745496f515af1461bb8d03ba6b5c7cac5e71150

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

Drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
